Turing Award 1986

Winner: Robert Tarjan

Tarjan is well-known for his work on graph theory algorithms and data structures, which he pioneered. Tarjan's off-line least common ancestors technique and Tarjan's highly linked components algorithm are two of his well-known algorithms, and he was one of five co-authors of the median of medians linear time selection algorithm. The Hopcroftâ€“Tarjan planarity-testing technique was the first to test planarity in linear time.
